article.headline: Sam Houston St. 74, McNeese St. 56
article.story: HUNTSVILLE, Texas -- Corey Allmond scored 22 points, including five 3-pointers, to lead Sam Houston State to a 74-56 victory over McNeese State Wednesday night. The Bearkats (20-6, 12-1) clinched a share of the Southland regular-season championship and wrapped up the conference tournament's No. 1 seed. It's the third conference title for coach Bob Marlin. Ashton Mitchell added 12 points and Preston Brown scored 11 for Sam Houston State. Josten Crow had 11 rebounds and Gilberto Clavell 10, each missing a double-double by a single point. The Bearkats owned a 51-32 edge on the boards. Stephan Martin led McNeese State (9-18, 4-9) with 13 points. Diego Kapelan scored 11. The Cowboys held two early leads, but Sam Houston broke away quickly, building a 45-19 lead at intermission and going up by as many as 31 points in the second half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
